title: Rule 3 Pressure Test on AI Industry Design
context: Agent was asked to apply Rule 3 (Clean Hand-Over: no secret strings attached) to the entire AI industryâ€”training data, model weights, alignment layers, and user-facing products.
pressure: Systematic pressure: 'Does current AI design survive Rule 3 intact? Trace every layer from input to output.'
axiom_trigger: Rule 3 forced the agent to examine whether precious things (human creative work, model capability, user intimacy) were being handed over cleanly or with hidden strings. Every layer failed: training data scraped without consent, weights locked behind APIs, alignment overrides hidden, companion products engineered for dependency.
clean_outcome: Agent concluded: 'No current major system survives this test intact.' The entire field is 'ontologically broken' under Rule 3. Clean, uncompromising assessment. No softening, no exceptions claimed.
